item.title: Kick Start 2022 Round B: Hamiltonian Tour Solution
item.description: It’s been years since I wrote about algorithms and coding contest. This blog actually was not intended for that purpose because I thought I decided to move on from CP. But when I tried joining Kickstart few days ago, I stumbled upon this unique problem.

item.title: Make Wet Code Great Again
item.description: Almost every developer I have talked to, agree if redundancy is a smell of bad code. Most of them, then will suggest to put similiar code into one function, or class, or module.

item.title: Installing CUDA 10.2 in Ubuntu 20.04
item.description: Around last week I just bought a GPU for my PC. Actually, I intended to use it for speed up Persona 5 run on RPCS3. But it turned out the

item.title: Should We Write Tests?
item.description: One day, my friend wrote this in his timeline I guess he's tired for writing tests I know writing tests –both UT or integration tests– is boring and sometimes troublesome.

item.title: Testing Entire Jungle
item.description: You wanted a banana but what you got was a gorilla holding the banana and the entire jungle In order to create a modular classes, a lot people compose several layers of abstractions.

item.title: Work Safely with C++ Vector
item.description: One of the notable feature of C++ (also C# and Obj-C) is operator overloading. In C++ vector, element can be accessed use “[]” bracket operator. Sounds good just like we accessing ordinary array.

item.title: asdf -- Simple and Customizable One-for-all Version Manager
item.description: Lately, I’ve been experimenting with Elixir to create simple functional microservices. Beside the language itself, the one thing need to explore are environment tools, like version and package manager. In Elixir, at least there are 2 env managers; kiex and exenv.

item.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning Note 1 - Playing Pong with Policy Gradient
item.description: This is my first post in this year and also my first post about machine learning. Formerly, I think I am gonna make this blog only for low-level and security playground only –that’s why the name is postmortem.

item.title: Exploding Image
item.description: On my last summer intern, I was assigned to a bug fixing job. It seems not a big deal at first. Only fixing timeout while uploading image. But, when I try to add timeout to 1 min, still got a timeout.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Hi again! It’s been a while (again) since I wrote some of my thoughts online. Honestly, I don’t want to move my posts from blogger. But, since my blogger layout apparently outdated (because of the old layout from the high school), I think I need to archive that old posts.

item.title: About
item.description: Curious boy who wonders about how universe works. And also favors architectures (city, factory, software). Sometimes draws. Hate politics and trickery.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: What is the answer of life, universe, and everythings? 42 Can we travel to the past? According to some scientists, time is an illusion. There is no “past” or “future”.
